Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan failed to achieve
compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
On 1/19/21, youth's hair was pulled and youth sustained an abrasion on left hand,
small cut on chest, and cut on the right side of the nose. This occurred at the facility,
but perpetrator is unknown.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on 1/21/21. The complaint was called in by the referral
source on 1/20/21. The complainant stated on 1/19/21, someone smacked Youth A
and pulled her hair. Youth A sustained an abrasion on her left hand, small cut on
her chest, and cut on the right side of her nose.
2

At the facility on 1/21/21 the Chief Administrator (CA) stated there was an incident
that occurred on 1/9/21 in which Youth A and the staff involved received injuries. He
stated there was not an incident on 1/19/21 with the youth. The therapist had
reported the incident to the Foster Care Worker (FCW) but the FCW did not address
it with them until 1/20/21. The CA provided an Incident Report from the incident.
An Incident Report (IR) dated 1/9/21 at 7:33pm was reviewed. It listed Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5 and the Supervisor as being involved in the incident. The
IR stated that Youth A had an abrasion on her left hand, a small cut on her chest,
and a cut on the right side of her nose. Staff 2 was hit on the right side of the head,
stabbed in the right arm with pencils, and kicked in the right knee. Staff 1 was hit on
the left shoulder, the chest, the base of the neck, and scratched on the right forearm.
Staff 3 had scratches on her right arm. No other employees were listed as having
injuries.
The report stated on 1/9/21 at approximately 7:25pm Youth A was in the milieu and
told staff she was upset with one of her peers. Staff spoke with Youth A and offered
her options to help assist with calming down. Youth A refused all options and began
to escalate. Youth jumped the kitchen counter and physically assaulted Staff 2 by
stabbing her with pencils. Youth A also hit Staff 2 on the right side of the head with
an aluminum bottle. A two-person seated hold was then conducted by Staff 1 and
Staff 2. Staff 3 assisted.
Youth A, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were all interviewed at the facility on 1/21/21.
Youth A Interview: Youth A stated she talked to her worker about what happened
to her and the people that make her upset. She was in the kitchen when she was
dragged out of the kitchen and restrained. Staff 1 hit her in the face and pulled her
hair. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were all there. Youth A stated that Staff 5 and a tall
guy with glasses saw the marks on her. Staff 1 put her hand on Youth A's face, over
her eye and cheek. Youth A's right eye was healing. She stated Staff 1 tried to hit
Youth A on purpose. She stated she did not know what to do so she "blacked out",
but when asked, did not know what "blacked out" meant. She stated that Staff 1
probably scratched her.
Staff 3 Interview: Staff 3 stated the management with Youth A happened on the 9th
which was a Saturday or a Sunday. The group was watching a movie and Staff 3
was passing nighttime meds. Youth A thought that another youth was talking about
her. Youth A began yelling at her peer. Staff 2 was able to get Youth A calmed
down. While Staff 3 was giving the rest of the meds Youth A "exploded." Youth A
was standing near the gate to the kitchen window. They cleared the other youth from
the unit. Youth A was making a screeching noise. They needed to get the gate to the
kitchen closed so she could not get in, but Youth A was standing too close to it. Staff
2 stated they needed to go hands on if she jumped the counter and tried to get into
the kitchen. The staff attempted to restraint Youth A but Youth A had grabbed
pencils and was stabbing staff with them. Staff 3 took the pencils out of Youth A's
3

hands. The staff again attempted to restrain Youth A but she was kicking and pulling
the staff's hair. They continued to try and manage Youth A and get her to calm
down. Staff 1 called for additional staff. Staff 1 was holding Youth A's legs so she did
not kick them. Staff 3 was holding one of Youth A's arms and Staff 2 was holding the
other. Staff 3 stated she never saw anyone hit Youth A in the face or pull Youth A's
hair. After the restraint Staff 3 did not see Youth A. Staff 3 stated she is not very
familiar with physical managements. She stated Youth A was laying on her back
during the management and Staff 3 was holding Youth A's wrist.
Staff 4 Interview: Staff 4 stated she was not involved in the physical management.
She saw Youth A after the hold. Youth A had an abrasion on her nose by her eye
that was small and bleeding a little. She also had a mark on her chest near her collar
bone. Youth A had a V-neck shirt on that could have been pulled down during the
restraint. Staff 4 stated the mark was like a bruise or a red mark the size of a
quarter. Staff 4 said she documented this in the incident report and let the nurse
know. Youth A did say that Staff 1 hit her, scratched her, and pulled her hair. The
Supervisor was there when Youth A said these things.
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 5 and the Supervisor were interviewed at the facility on 1/22/21.
Staff 1 Interview: Staff 1 stated she was diagnosed with a concussion from the
incident with Youth A. She stated she came out of the office and Youth A had a hold
of Staff 2's hair. Youth A was yelling and cussing. Youth A let go of Staff 2's hair,
then went to go over the counter to the kitchen. Youth A got into the kitchen and was
assaulting staff. Staff 1 helped Staff 2 with the restraint. Staff 1 said she had to hold
Youth A's head to keep Youth A from biting anyone. While Staff 1 held Youth A's
head Youth A kicked Staff 1 in the chest. Staff 1 then held Youth A's feet so she
could not kick.
Staff 1 stated they tried to restrain Youth A but Staff 3 left, so it was just Staff 1 and
Staff 2. Before Staff 3 left, Staff 2 and Staff 3 were already trying to hold Youth A's
hands and trying to restraint Youth A. Youth A was laying on her back.
Youth A never said anything about being hurt or someone hurting her. Youth A was
banging her head during the hold. Staff 1 said she did not grab Youth A's hair and
she never hit Youth A in the face. No one else did either.
Staff 5 Interview: Staff 5 could not remember the day of the incident, but she
believed it was a weekend. She was called over to help. Youth A was laying on her
back on the kitchen floor screaming that staff hurt her. Staff 5 tried to talk Youth A
into leaving the kitchen. Youth A turned and tried to hit a staff. Youth A then laid on
the floor for a few minutes. Youth A said Staff 1 slapped her across the face. Youth
A continued to scream and cry until she finally left the kitchen. Once Youth A left the
kitchen, she stated that staff scratched her. She had a mark on her chest, her hand,
and by her nose. Staff 4, Staff 5, and the Supervisor all talked to Youth A about the
incident. Youth A then talked privately with the Supervisor. Staff 5 went to check on
4

the other youth. When Staff 5 returned Youth A was still saying Staff 1 hit her in the
face. Staff 5 stated that the Supervisor told her that he had it all handled. She asked
Staff 2 what else she should do, and Staff 2 said it was all set.
Staff 5 stated that the way Staff 1 talks to the youth is concerning to her. Staff 1 has
made comments about not liking Youth A. She has seen Staff 1 restrain youth and
the restraints always look correct.
Staff 2 Interview: Staff 2 stated she is the assistant supervisor, and she was
working a double on 1/9/21. Youth A was upset with another youth. Youth A grabbed
Staff 2's hair and Staff 1 was able to get her free. There was no restraint at this
point. Youth A was also kicking Staff 2 in the knee. Youth A was then able to get into
the kitchen and stab Staff 2 with pencils and hit her with an aluminum bottle. They
tried to do a restraint but Staff 3 left. Staff 1 and Staff 2 then restrained Youth A.
Youth A kicked them. Staff 2 stated she did not know why Staff 3 left. Staff 2 was
punched and kicked repeatedly by Youth A. Before Staff 3 left they were able to get
Youth A into a seated two person hold. Youth A was banging her head, scratching
herself, and stating she was going to get them fired. Staff 2 and Staff 1 each had an
arm. She could not remember what Staff 3 was doing. Staff 4 and Staff 5 came in
and talked to Youth A. Staff 2 went to take a break. Youth A was telling Staff 4 and
Staff 5 that the other staff had attacked her. Staff 2 stated no one pulled Youth A’s
hair. Staff 1 did not hold Youth A's head. Staff 2 just blocked her own face from spit
by putting her hand to her own face. No one harmed Youth A or escalated the
situation. No one said staff hit Youth A not even Youth A. After every restraint Youth
A says staff hurt her. Staff 2 has been off on medical leave since the incident and
has been diagnosed with a concussion.
Supervisor Interview: The Supervisor stated he was the Evening Campus
Supervisor the night of the incident with Youth A. He is also an Aegis (the facilities
restraint technique) trainer. He was in his office when he got a call from Staff 4 that
Youth A's unit needed assistance. When he got to Youth A's unit she was on the
floor crying. Staff 4 and Staff 5 were sitting with her and they were able to get Youth
A to leave the kitchen and take her medication. The supervisor and Staff 5 then sat
with Youth A. Youth A told them she has a cut on her hand, chest, and eye. The cut
on Youth A's hand was very small. He did not see the mark on her chest. The mark
on her face was between her nose and her eye. He was unsure if the mark on her
face was bleeding but it was red. The mark was about a half an inch in length. Youth
A stated she was going to get Staff 1 fired. Youth A said she got hit in the face, but
she did not know who hit her in the face. Youth A also said the staff stabbed her with
a pencil. Youth A just said "one of them" did it.
The Supervisor went to another unit and saw Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. He asked
them what happened. They told him Youth A went into the kitchen and staff went to
get her out then Youth A attacked them. He asked them why Youth A was saying
they hit her, and the staff denied they had. The staff never mentioned that they
restrained Youth A. He is supposed to be present for any restraints.
5

The supervisor stated that if there was an allegation of abuse or neglect the home
Supervisor (not him) would make the report to Central Intake. The Supervisor stated
he notified nursing of Youth A's injuries and sent an e-mail to the managers. He
stated it was not his job to call in the allegations.
The Supervisor reviews the Incident Reports when they are sent to him, but he does
not review all of them just the ones that happen on his shift.
The Supervisor stated if a resident were to lay on the floor during a restraint the staff
would need to disengage from the hold. The Aegis training does not teach anything
about blocking spit. He stated staff are not supposed to hold a youth's head down.
The Supervisor provided the e-mail he sent to the other managers. The e-mail was
sent to eight individuals and the supervisors group. The CA was not included on this
e-mail. The e-mail was dated 1/10/21 at 9:29pm. It stated that Youth A’s unit asked
for assistance. He went to the unit and found Youth A sitting in the kitchen crying
and screaming at staff. Youth A was able to get up and walk out of the kitchen
without the use of physical management. Youth A had gotten into an argument with
a peer, then jumped into the kitchen from the window. Staff attempted to get her out.
Youth A assaulted staff with pencils and a metal water bottle. Youth A kicked, spit,
and scratched staff who were trying to get her out of the kitchen. The supervisor
listed Youth A’s injuries and stated Youth A claimed she was hit and scratched by
staff. All staff report that these injuries were likely self-inflicted as Youth A had
verbalized wanting to get staff fired.
Staff files indicated the following:
 Staff 1 was hired on 12/13/19. She did not have any disciplines in her file.
She had mandated reporter training on 1/17/20 and Crisis Prevention & De-
escalation on 9/17/20.
 Staff 2 was hired on 5/12/14. She had seven disciplines in her file. Six
disciplines were for not completing mandatory training and one for restraint
and seclusion that occurred in 2015. Staff 2 had mandated reporter training
on 1/9/20 and Crisis Prevention & De-escalation on 12/22/20.
 Staff 3 was hired on 9/14/20. She did not have any disciplines in her file. She
received mandated reporter training on 9/19/20 and Crisis Prevention & De-
escalation on 10/29/20.
 Staff 4 was hired on 4/9/18. She had one discipline for a medication error.
She had mandated reporter training on 8/22/19 and Crisis Prevention & de-
escalation on 10/6/20.
 Staff 5 was hired on 9/23/19. She did not have any disciplines in her file. She
completed mandated reporter training on 9/14/20 and Crisis Prevention & De-
escalation on 10/22/20.
 Supervisor was hired on 11/7/18. He received two disciplines in 2020 one
was for documentation and communication. The other was for a medication
6

error. He received mandated reporter training on 11/13/20 and Crisis
Prevention & De-escalation on 9/24/20.
Youth A’s case file indicated she was placed at the facility on 4/10/19. Youth A is
14 years old and has a cognitive impairment. She has difficulty controlling her
impulses and can be unpredictable. She antagonizes her peers and can become
physically aggressive toward staff and peers. Since being in her current placement
these behaviors have decreased.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
ANALYSIS: The interviews conducted with the staff indicated that the staff
involved in the incident did not hit, scratch, or pull Youth A’s
hair.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
INVESTIGATION:
During Staff 3’s interview she stated that Youth A was laying on her back when the
staff were attempting to retrain her.
Staff 1 stated in her interview that Youth A was laying on her back when they were
trying to restrain her.
Staff 2 stated Youth A was in a seated two person hold.
The incident report also indicated that Youth A was placed in a two-person seated
hold.
The Supervisor stated he was unaware that a restraint was conducted on Youth A
the night of the incident. The Supervisor, who is a trainer for physical managements
at the facility, stated if a youth is laying on the floor the staff are to disengage the
restraint.
7

The facility’s Aegis restraint training states that it does not use any type of prone or
supine positioning. The technique only utilizes seated and standing positions.
The facility’s Crisis Management Procedure states physical intervention can only be
performed according to the Aegis System.
APPLICABLE RULE
Emergency PROHIBITION OF PRONE RESTRAINT; PROCEDURES
Rules INVOLVING OTHER RESTRAINTS IN CHILD CARING
INSTITUTIONS
Rule 1. (1) A child caring institution (CCI) must establish and
follow written policies and procedures regarding restraint.
These policies and procedures shall be available to all
residents, their families, and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: The staff did not follow the agency’s policy as Staff 1 and Staff 3
stated Youth A was laying on her back when they were
attempting to restrain her. The incident report did not indicate
that Youth A was laying on her back.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
INVESTIGATION:
During the above investigation it was discovered that the incident in question took
place on 1/9/21. A review of MiSACWIS found that the facility called in the
allegations alleged by Youth A on 1/20/21 at 5:31pm.
During the DHHS Case Conference the Foster Care Worker stated the incident was
reported to her but she was on leave. When she returned, she addressed the
allegations with the facility and the facility then called in the allegations.
Staff 4 stated, in her interview, that Youth A alleged staff hit her, scratched her, and
pulled her hair. Staff 4 indicated she saw Youth A’s injuries. Staff 4 stated she did
not report the alleged abuse because the Supervisor was present when Youth A
said this.
During Staff 5’s interview she reported that Youth A alleged staff slapped her across
the face and that the Supervisor told Staff 5 that he would handle it.
8

The Supervisor stated that Youth A alleged staff hit her in the face and stabbed her
with pencils. The Supervisor indicated he saw Youth A’s injuries. He talked to the
staff and they denied any of them hit or stabbed her. The Supervisor reported it is
not his job to report allegations of abuse as he is not the house supervisor. He did
send an e-mail which indicated Youth A’s allegations to several supervisors and
managers.
The Incident Report provided did not indicate Youth A made allegations of abuse.
The facility’s Client Protection Procedures were reviewed. All employees of the
facility are legally required to notify Central Intake if they become aware that a client
may have been abused, neglected, injured or mistreated in some way by a staff
member. The employee shall promptly make a verbal report to Central Intake. A
written report shall follow within 72 hours. Employees are strongly encouraged, but
not legally required, to notify their Shift Supervisor, Supervisor or Associate Director
and the Agency’s Client Rights Advisor. An Incident Report should also be written to
document the allegations. Training documents from the facility confirm the same.
The Facility’s Crisis Management Procedure states that any injury that occurs during
the course of a restraint must be reported to Central Intake.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
required.
The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA
238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638
ANALYSIS: The interviews with Staff 4, Staff 5, and the Supervisor indicate
that Youth A made allegations of abuse and had injuries, but
those allegations were not called in to Central Intake until 11
days after the incident. The allegations also were not included in
the Incident Report.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan it is recommended that this
investigation be closed with no further licensing action.
